summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview conducted on December 17, 2019, with a victim/witness (referred to as [Victim 1]) regarding her sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The document details the grooming process, locations of abuse, and the roles of Epstein, Maxwell, and other assistants. It also mentions other potential witnesses and provides their contact information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary perpetrator of sexual abuse described in the interview. The victim details being groomed and abused by him from age 14.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Actively participated in grooming the victim and joined in sexual acts with Epstein. Described as normalizing the abuse and coordinating travel.

persons.name: [Victim 1]
persons.context: The primary interviewee who describes being sexually abused by Epstein and Maxwell from ages 14 to 17 in New York, Florida, and New Mexico.

persons.name: Mike Wallace
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the victim was brought over to say happy birthday to at Epstein's home.

persons.name: [Victim 2]
persons.context: Another victim mentioned by the interviewee. The interviewee states [Victim 2] told her she had been abused by Epstein.

persons.name: [Ex-Boyfriend]
persons.context: An ex-boyfriend of the interviewee who knew of Epstein but not the abuse. He was possessive and did not want to be around Epstein.

persons.name: [Friend 1]
persons.context: A friend of the interviewee who also knew Epstein and Maxwell. The interviewee suggests the government should speak with him due to his good memory.

persons.name: [Assistant]
persons.context: Epstein's assistant who was involved in the abuse according to the interviewee. The interviewee states this assistant's involvement 'ruined her life'.

persons.name: [Chef]
persons.context: One of Epstein's private chefs in New York who also traveled to New Mexico.

persons.name: [Dean]
persons.context: The dean of Interlochen, who was also the dean of admissions for Juilliard, was met by the victim through Epstein and attended a cocktail party at his home.

persons.name: [Massage Therapist]
persons.context: A recurring massage therapist in Florida who gave sexual massages. Possibly named [Name].

persons.name: [Driver]
persons.context: Epstein's driver, described as a Latin American man whose wife also worked in the house. He transported the victim.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney present for the interview.

connections.description: Worked together to groom and sexually abuse the victim. Maxwell participated in sexual acts and normalized the abuse for the victim.
Epstein sexually abused [Victim 1] from the age of 14, including masturbation, use of toys, and sexual intercourse.
Maxwell groomed [Victim 1], participated in sexual acts with her and Epstein, and coached her and other girls.
Friends who discussed the abuse. [Victim 2] confided in [Victim 1] about being abused by Epstein.
Friends. [Victim 1] suggests investigators speak with [Friend 1] as he has a good memory and knew Epstein and Maxwell.
[Assistant] worked for Epstein and was involved in the abuse, according to the victim.
The driver worked for Epstein, transporting the victim to and from locations.

events.title: Summer in New York and First Abuse
events.description: The victim spent the summer in New York at age 14. She met Epstein for headshots, which is when he first masturbated in front of her, marking the start of the abuse.

events.title: Grooming and Escalating Abuse
events.description: Over several years, from ages 14-17, the victim was groomed by Epstein and Maxwell. Abuse escalated to include Maxwell's participation, use of sex toys, and sexual intercourse in New York, Florida, and New Mexico.

events.title: Epstein's 2008 Arrest
events.description: Mentioned as a temporal marker; a conversation the victim had with another person happened prior to Epstein's arrest in 2008.

events.title: Recent Conversation with [Victim 2]
events.description: The victim recently spoke with [Victim 2] about the case, and [Victim 2] was emotional, stating Epstein had a 'god complex'.

events.title: FBI Interview
events.description: The victim was interviewed by the FBI regarding her abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The victim was first abused by Jeffrey Epstein at age 14 in New York under the guise of taking headshots.
Ghislaine Maxwell actively participated in the sexual abuse, grooming the victim, and normalizing the encounters, stating 'this is what grown ups do'.
Abuse occurred in multiple locations (New York, Florida, New Mexico) and often involved a massage table.
The victim describes a 'class system' among Epstein's victims and details how Maxwell's participation decreased as the abuse became more one-on-one.
The document lists several other individuals (friends, other victims, staff) who may have information relevant to the investigation.
